messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new syndrome?
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I guess I posted it just as another example of a natural part of life being labeled as something needing to be fixed with medication.-=- It s crazy, isn t
messages.messageBody:
-=-I guess I posted it just as another example of a natural part of
life being
labeled as something needing to be
'fixed' with medication.-=-

It's crazy, isn't it? That preferences and personal differences
become "syndromes" and "disabilities" and that?

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new syndrome?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Wendy S. in GA Mom to Shelby, Age 9 http://ourjourneyfantastic.blogspot.com/ Come to the Trust Birth Conference! March 7-9, 2008 in Redondo Beach,
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 22, 2008, at 1:31 PM, Heather wrote:

> Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome - a disorder in which people do not
> feel ready
> to sleep until very late and also have trouble waking up in the
> morning.Well that fits my family. :-) How ridiculous!


Wendy S. in GA
Mom to Shelby, Age 9
http://ourjourneyfantastic.blogspot.com/

Come to the Trust Birth Conference!
March 7-9, 2008 in Redondo Beach, California
www.trustbirthconference.com

****************
BIRTH IS SAFE, INTERVENTION IS RISKY
http://www.trustbirth.com/

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new syndrome?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ah.  If I was more awake in the mornings, I would have gotten that  Nancy
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 22, 2008, at 11:00 AM, Heather wrote:

> <<what's your point in posting it, though?>>
>
> I guess I posted it just as another example of a natural part of
> life being
> labeled as something needing to be
> 'fixed' with medication. I was just so surprised to read about
> staying up
> late & sleeping in - something I
> do on a regular basis, by the way - in just such a negative way & in
> such
> black & white terms.
>

Ah. If I was more awake in the mornings, I would have gotten that <ggg>

Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new syndrome?
messages.messageBody:
<<what's your point in posting it, though?>>

I guess I posted it just as another example of a natural part of life being
labeled as something needing to be
'fixed' with medication. I was just so surprised to read about staying up
late & sleeping in - something I
do on a regular basis, by the way - in just such a negative way & in such
black & white terms.

heather m


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new syndrome?
messages.msgSnippet: ... That sounds like my 20 y.o. dd...  what s your point in posting it, though? Nancy
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 22, 2008, at 10:31 AM, Heather wrote:

> Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome - a disorder in which people do not
> feel ready
> to sleep until very late and also have trouble waking up in the
> morning.
>
> (!!!)
>
> This was in my local newspaper - in an ad for a clinical research
> study.
>
> -heather m
>


That sounds like my 20 y.o. dd... what's your point in posting it,
though?

Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new syndrome?
messages.msgSnippet: Is that what it is called?  After 40 years, I still stay up late and have trouble getting up in the morning. My mom always called it Being a night owl .
messages.messageBody:
Is that what it is called? After 40 years, I still stay up late and have trouble getting up in the morning. My mom always called it "Being a night owl".
Oneida

Heather <swingdancechick@...> wrote:
Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome - a disorder in which people do not feel ready
to sleep until very late and also have trouble waking up in the morning.

(!!!)

This was in my local newspaper - in an ad for a clinical research study.

-heather m

messages.subject: a new syndrome?
messages.msgSnippet: Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome - a disorder in which people do not feel ready to sleep until very late and also have trouble waking up in the morning. (!!!) This
messages.messageBody:
Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome - a disorder in which people do not feel ready
to sleep until very late and also have trouble waking up in the morning.

(!!!)

This was in my local newspaper - in an ad for a clinical research study.

-heather m
